definition: to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to go from house to house
to go from house to house
from house to house, one by one
to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
erhua variant of 挨個|挨个[ai1 ge4]
to approach/to get close to/to sneak up on/near to
from house to house, one by one
to be the target of an attack

sentences.english: Many cars lay jostling each other at the parking lot.
sentences.chinese: 许多汽车在停车场上紧紧挨在一起。

sentences.english: On top of a tongue-lashing, he got a beating as well.
sentences.chinese: 他挨了骂不算，还挨了一顿打。

sentences.english: On top of a tongue-lashing, he got a beating as well.
sentences.chinese: 他挨了骂不算，还挨了一顿打。

sentences.english: We don't want to come down too hard on her.
sentences.chinese: 我们本来不想和她挨得太紧。

sentences.english: He held out his hand unflinchingly for the cane.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不畏缩地伸出手去挨藤条打。

sentences.english: Get plank brick this matter, if stem good, call to meekly tolerate insult negative heavy.
sentences.chinese: 挨板砖这事，如果干得好，叫忍辱负重。

sentences.english: The dog snuzzled against its master.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗用鼻子挨擦它的主人。

sentences.english: If the foot endures the word that irons vent-pipe, what method can go scar?
sentences.chinese: 脚如果挨烫到排气管的话，有什么办法可以去疤？

sentences.english: Obey the teacher or get hit with a strap.
sentences.chinese: 要么听老师的话，要么等着挨皮带。

sentences.english: You'll catch it if Mrs Brown finds you trampling on her flowers beds.
sentences.chinese: 如果布朗太太发现你踩她的花坛，你会挨一顿痛骂。

sentences.english: We just have two carrots, how can we afford going Nother ?
sentences.chinese: 我们才只有两根萝卜，怎能挨到上京？

sentences.english: What time did you finally hit the sack last night, Morgan?
sentences.chinese: 摩根，你昨晚挨到什么时候才上床？

sentences.english: They have to meet all types of people.
sentences.chinese: 他们得战各种范例的人挨交讲。

sentences.english: In return, a swift fist landed on the officer's neck.
sentences.chinese: 作为回敬，这位警察的脖子上挨了飞快的一拳。

sentences.english: Meat that touches anything ceremonially unclean must not be eaten; it must be burned up.
sentences.chinese: 挨了污秽物的肉就不可吃，要用火焚烧。

sentences.english: About twenty or thirty of them a week were falling on London at present.
sentences.chinese: 目前，像这样的火箭弹伦敦大约每周要挨上二三十枚。

to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
to beat up/to break to pieces

a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
